intro: Myosotis glomerata, commonly known as the clustered forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that grow in dense clusters, typically on slender stems. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils in shady or semi-shaded environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early autumn. Myosotis glomerata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also found in natural habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
